quest.name: Mord of the Ring
journal:
 Quest Sync
Ghun Gun is thrilled by the signet ring you have discovered.

Ghun Gun is positively ecstatic at your discovery of an ancient signet ring beneath the rubble, and is eager to learn its true value. He suggests seeking the advice of someone well versed in such antiquities, and races back to Mord Souq.

※Please note that the difficulty of this quest has been synced to your current level.

Ghun Gun points you in the direction of one of his father's associates. Although it is unclear whether he possesses any experience in the field of evaluating unearthed relics, your companion has every confidence that he can provide the information you seek.

Unfortunately, the merchant is unable to reveal much, other than the fact that the signet ring originates from Nabaath Areng. Given the history of the area, this comes as little surprise. The most useful piece of information you can glean from him is that there is another trader to the south who may be able to shed a touch more light on the matter.

You show the signet ring to the dealer in antiquities, who points out that this was no mere piece of jewelry, but one used by somebody wealthy to seal letters and so forth. Though he lacks the knowledge of ancient sigils required to identify its former owner, he recommends that you consult a man named Jamial, who is apparently the most reliable source of information regarding such artifacts.

You hand the ring to Jamial for inspection, who can scarcely believe his eyes. He reveals that it bears the sigil of a malik, the equivalent of a king in Nabaath Areng. Although the signet is priceless to an expert such as Jamial, he regretfully informs you that only a historian can tell it apart from those used by countless nobles and affluent individuals. Not to be disheartened, Ghun Gun instead views this as a favorable outcome to the day's events, with the satisfaction of a job well done being all the reward he needs.

dialogue.name: GHUNGUN
dialogue.text: Such a pretty ring! Almost too precious to sell. Almost.

dialogue.name: GHUNGUN
dialogue.text: We will ask a friend of my father's how much it is worth. He is a good man, we can trust him! Well, as much as we can trust anyone that my father would call a friend...

dialogue.name: GHUNGUN
dialogue.text: Anyway, let us meet in Mord Souq. Once we are done, we can discuss your reward!

dialogue.name: GHUNGUN
dialogue.text: Heh heh! Only thing sweeter than a hand full of shinies is a purse full of jinglies!

dialogue.name: GHUNGUN
dialogue.text: Very close, he is! This way!

dialogue.name: GHUNGUN
dialogue.text: He knows much about old things, ancient things! More than me, anyway...

dialogue.name: MERCHANTA03376
dialogue.text: What have you got for me tonighttoday?

dialogue.name: GHUNGUN
dialogue.text: I am not sure, but it is a very lovely shiny! Here, take a look!

dialogue.name: MERCHANTA03376
dialogue.text: Let me see... My word, this is exquisite!

dialogue.name: MERCHANTA03376
dialogue.text: Judging by the sigil, I'd say this originates from Nabaath Areng. You'll need to find an expert in that period to ascertain its true value, though.

dialogue.name: GHUNGUN
dialogue.text: You mean you do not know!?

dialogue.name: MERCHANTA03376
dialogue.text: Sorry, Ghun Gun. But the chap with a cart near the south gate might be able to help. White hair, smells of cabbage.

dialogue.name: GHUNGUN
dialogue.text: Then we shall ask him. Thank you for your kind advice!

dialogue.name: GHUNGUN
dialogue.text: Smells like cabbage, eh? He should be easy to find in that case!

dialogue.name: MERCHANTA03376
dialogue.text: I'm afraid the most I can tell you is that it's from old Nabaath Areng. Beyond that, your guess is as good as mine.

dialogue.name: GHUNGUN
dialogue.text: We have found him! Let us see what he thinks of the ring!

dialogue.name: MERCHANTB03376
dialogue.text: May I help you?

dialogue.name: GHUNGUN
dialogue.text: Please, tell us what this old ring is worth!

dialogue.name: MERCHANTB03376
dialogue.text: Ho ho, I have not seen one of these in a very long time.

dialogue.name: GHUNGUN
dialogue.text: Well, what is it?

dialogue.name: MERCHANTB03376
dialogue.text: This is no simple ring. See that sigil? Used to seal letters, it was. The owner must have been someone quite important. But you'd best speak with Jamial if you want to know who it belonged to. If you want to know about crests and such, he's the one to ask.

dialogue.name: GHUNGUN
dialogue.text: Gah! Not again! I just want my jinglies!

dialogue.name: GHUNGUN
dialogue.text: Hopefully Jamial will be the last one we have to ask.

dialogue.name: MERCHANTB03376
dialogue.text: Jamial knows a lot more about the great houses of Nabaath Areng than I do.

dialogue.name: GHUNGUN
dialogue.text: Jamial is quite well known around Mord Souq, you know. He has been here for a very long time!

dialogue.name: JAMIAL
dialogue.text: Now, what could you two spry younglings need from an old man like me?

dialogue.name: GHUNGUN
dialogue.text: We want to know how much we can get for this signet ring. Please tell us─the suspense is killing me!

dialogue.name: JAMIAL
dialogue.text: Where did you get this!? It belonged to a malik of Nabaath Areng!

dialogue.name: GHUNGUN
dialogue.text: Oh, that sounds very valuable indeed! So...how much?

dialogue.name: JAMIAL
dialogue.text: To a historian, it is priceless. In all likelihood, there is only one such ring in existence.

dialogue.name: JAMIAL
dialogue.text: Though, I am afraid that to the layman unversed in ancient sigils, it is worth no more than any other signet of a similar age. Anyone in Nabaath Areng with even a modicum of wealth would have had one bearing their mark.

dialogue.name: GHUNGUN
dialogue.text: So...it is priceless but also not worth very much? I am confused.

dialogue.name: GHUNGUN
dialogue.text: It looks like we will not be rolling in riches after all... I am very sorry to have dragged you around Mord Souq for nothing!

dialogue.name: GHUNGUN
dialogue.text: But as we always say, “No such thing as a thing no one needs!” and “Hard work is its own reward!” Something like that, anyway.

dialogue.name: GHUNGUN
dialogue.text: While your coinpurse may be no heavier than before, you have learned an important lesson! At least, I think so...

obj.n: Work to Live or Live to Work
